entry.name: MAVNET_SYSTEM_TYPE_SUBSCRIBER
entry.description: Subscriber systems such as a ground control station comm stack

entry.name: MAVNET_SYSTEM_TYPE_PUBLISHER
entry.description: Publisher systems such as an unmanned vehicle or sensor

entry.name: SENSOR_TYPE_CESER
entry.description: MAVNet CESER Machine Learning / Docker container that processes imagery and identifies infrastructure item(Payload)

entry.name: SENSOR_TYPE_ISSMS
entry.description: MAVNet specialized sensor for ISSMS project(Payload)

entry.name: SENSOR_TYPE_SILVUSRADIO
entry.description: MAVNet Reporting interface to Silvus Streamcaster Radio (temp, RSSI, battery)(Payload)

entry.name: POINT
entry.description: Point annotation, fields include name, comm group, lat, lon and color. Clamped to ground.

entry.name: CIRCLE
entry.description: Circle annotation, fields include name, comm group, lat, lon of center, radius, stroke color and fill color. Clamped to ground.

entry.name: CYLINDER
entry.description: Cylinder annotation, fields include name, comm group, lat, lon of center, radius, stroke color, fill color, and height (AGL).

entry.name: POLYGON
entry.description: Polygon annotation, fields include name, comm group, stroke color, fill color and up to 12 points, lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, etc. The polygon should be closed between the last defined point and the first defined point. clamped to ground.

entry.name: POLYGON_3D
entry.description: 3D Polygon annotation, fields include name, comm group, stroke color, fill color, and up to 12 3d points, lat1, lon1, alt1, lat2, lon2, alt2 etc. The polygon should be closed between the last defined point and the first defined point. Altitudes are AGL.

entry.name: POINT_IMAGE
entry.description: Special point annotation that includes an image. Fields include name, comm group, lat, lon, color, full size image url and thumbnail url. Clamped to ground.

entry.name: INFRASTRUCTURE
entry.description: Special point_image annotation that includes additional fields such as type of infrastructure, identification confidence, damage rating, and an optional image. Clamped to ground.

enum.name: BOOLEAN_ENUM
enum.description: Simple ENUM for On/Off values instead of uint8_t. This indicates to the UI to use a STEP graph for this item.

enum.name: GPS_STATE
enum.description: These flags encode GPS state. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: STANDBY
entry.description: Device is in standby/low power mode if supported

enum.name: SENSOR_CSTAR_FLAGS
enum.description: These flags encode CStar Sensor state. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: SENSOR_CSTAR_FLAG_ISCONNECTED
entry.description: 0b00000001 Is CAN Bus connected to J1939.

enum.name: SENSOR_N2NMONITOR_STATUS
enum.description: These flags enumerate the states of each monitored connection.

enum.name: SENSOR_N2NMONITOR_MODE
enum.description: These flags enumerate the mode for each N2N declared connection.

entry.name: Auto
entry.description: Monitor and try to ReConnect if disconnected

enum.name: CSTAR_ALERTS
enum.description: These flags enumerate the various alert conditions that a C-Star unit can report.

entry.name: Battery
entry.description: Battery Low, value is current millivolts

entry.name: IMU_Roll
entry.description: IMU "Tip" Roll Angle, value is signed hundredths of degrees

entry.name: IMU_Pitch
entry.description: IMU "Tip" Pitch, value is signed hundredths of degrees

entry.name: IMU_Lateral
entry.description: Lateral IMU G's in signed milli-Gs

entry.name: Tow_Detected
entry.description: System is detecting that the truck is being towed

entry.name: IMU_Vertical
entry.description: Vertical IMU G's in signed milli-Gs

enum.name: ISSMS_ALERTS
enum.description: These flags enumerate the various alert conditions that an ISSMS unit can report.

entry.name: Battery
entry.description: Battery Low, value is current millivolts

entry.name: IMU_Roll
entry.description: IMU Roll Angle, value is signed hundredths of degrees

entry.name: IMU_Pitch
entry.description: IMU Pitch, value is signed hundredths of degrees

entry.name: Temp
entry.description: Temperature, C. Ambient, CPU, or LTE,

enum.name: BVM_ALERTS
enum.description: Battery Voltage Monitor Alert conditions. Used by the Battery Sensor. Not Bit flags.

enum.name: REMOTEID_TRANSMISSION_MODES
enum.description: The transmission modes the DroneScout 230 can detect.

enum.name: REMOTEID_UATYPES
enum.description: The UA Types supported, matches ODID_uatype.

enum.name: SENSORMGR_CMDS
enum.description: Commands to be forwarded to the SensorManager and then forwarded to Sensors support these commands. The will be sent to ALL Sensors unless a non-zero component ID is specified. Each sensor specified what commands it listens for.

entry.name: SensorState
entry.description: Set Sensor State. Param3:1-On,0-Off Param4:Operating Mode.

entry.name: WAESFanSpeed
entry.description: Change the WAES Fan Speed. Param3: UINT from 0-5, zero for off

enum.name: SENSOR_CAMERA_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode elements of state. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERA_FLAG_ONBOARD_STORAGE
entry.description: 0b00001000 Indicates camera has on-board storage for images and/or video.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERA_FLAG_IMAGE_CAPABLE
entry.description: 0b00000010 Indicates still image functionality is available.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERA_ONBOARD
entry.description: 0b00000001 Indicates the Camera is on-board, images can be transfered to the companion computer.

enum.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode elements of state. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_GRR
entry.description: 0b00100000 Indicates Camera is in GRR mode.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_FORWARD
entry.description: 0b00010000 Indicates Camera is facing forward in a fixed pilot position.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_MANUAL
entry.description: 0b00001000 Indicates camera is being manually set in a fixed(pan/tilt) position.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_PTC
entry.description: 0b00000100 Indicates Camera will Point to Target ROIs from MAVNet.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_STOWED
entry.description: 0b00000001 Indicates Camera is in a SAFE, but not operational, position for Landing or Take-off.

enum.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_VIDEO_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode elements of state. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_VIDEO_PIP
entry.description: 0b00000100 Indicates Camera is in a Picture-in-Picture mode.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_VIDEO_THERMAL
entry.description: 0b00000010 Indicates Camera is in a Thermal mode.

entry.name: SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_VIDEO_EO
entry.description: 0b00000001 Indicates Camera is in a EO mode.

enum.name: ASSET_STATE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode elements of state. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: ASSET_STATE_FLAG_VTOL_ENGAGED
entry.description: 0b00001000 Indicate that the asset is operating in VTOL mode.

entry.name: ASSET_STATE_FLAG_VTOL_CAPABLE
entry.description: 0b00000100 Indicate that the asset is capable of VTOL mode.

entry.name: ASSET_STATE_FLAG_TETHERED
entry.description: 0b00000010 Indicate that the asset is connected to a cable.

entry.name: ASSET_STATE_FLAG_DISENGAGED
entry.description: 0b00000001 Indicate that MAVNet has been overridden by a mode change or mavlink gcs (e.g. disengaged).

enum.name: MAVNET_SENSOR_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode elements of sensor reports. They are OR-combined flags.

entry.name: MAVNET_SENSOR_FLAG_NO_PARAMS
entry.description: 0b00000100 Enabled if the sensor does not use parameters. Setting this to 1 will prevent server from asking for parameters

entry.name: MAVNET_SENSOR_FLAG_AUTOGROUP
entry.description: 0b00000010 The sensor should autotaically be grouped with its asset / platform by callsign.

entry.name: MAVNET_SENSOR_FLAG_GROUP_EPHEMERAL
entry.description: 0b00000001 The sensor group is transitive and should be re-evaluated on each power on cycle.

enum.name: MAVNET_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAVNet processor. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This format is copied from the MAV_CMD enum. Note: When a position may be specified, if the lat/lon are given as 0/0 the position should be interpreted as NULL.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_PAUSE
entry.description: Put the system into a paused state.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff to navigation height and hold position
entry.param: Takeoff height AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (0 for default)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_LAND
entry.description: Navigate to the given position and land. If the position is (0,0,0), then land at home otherwise land at given location.
entry.param: Approximate gound level, MSL in meters * 1000
AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_ABORT
entry.description: The vehicle will switch to RTL mode and go to the nearest rally point (if specified) or the launch position. Vehicles may land when this position is reached.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_GO_TO
entry.param: Approximate gound level, MSL in meters * 1000
Start height AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (0 for current)
AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_IMMEDIATE_ALT
entry.description: Set the ImmediateAltitude state to a given value.
entry.param: AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_SPEED
entry.description: Set the desired horizontal navigation speed of the vehicle in decimeters per second.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_GO_HOME
entry.description: Move to the lat/lon position where the asset was ARMED
entry.param: Start height AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (0 for current)
AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_TARGET_POSITION
entry.description: Set the target position. Position may be NULL to clear the target parameter.
entry.param: Approximate gound level, MSL in meters * 1000
AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_GRIPPER
entry.description: Set the gripper state to hold or release.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_SENSOR_STATE
entry.description: Set the switch state(s) ON, OFF, STANDBY (Low Power)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_FLOWRATE
entry.description: Sets the desired flow rate of the target component
entry.param: Flow rate setpoint in SCCM (cm^3/min at 0C, 1bar)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_TETHER
entry.description: Set the tether state to hold or release.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_MISSION_RUN
entry.param: Mission sequence number at which to start execution.
Start height AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (0 for current)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_HOME_POINT
entry.param: AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_RALLY_POINT
entry.param: AHL (Altitude above home level), in meters * 1000 (positive for up)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_DELAY
entry.description: MISSION_LOOP - Delay mission execution for a period of time or indefinitely.
entry.param: DelayTime (-1: Infinite pause, > 1: delay for the specified period)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_TARGET_FOLLOW
entry.description: MISSION_LOOP - Set a target system for the mission executor to follow.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_INTERVAL
entry.description: Change the interval of MAVLink messages.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_COMM_MODE
entry.description: Change the communication mode of radios.
entry.param: Line of sight radio (as described by COMM_MODE enum, other=IGNORE)
Internet/Cellular (as described by COMM_MODE enum, other=IGNORE)
Satellite (as described by COMM_MODE enum, other=IGNORE)
State Messages (as described by COMM_MODE enum, other=IGNORE)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_IDENTIFY
entry.description: Request a system to send it's COMM_REGISTRATION information.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_VIDEO
entry.description: Request to start or stop a video system.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_CAMERA_TRIGGER
entry.description: Request to save a still image.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_COMPASS_DEC
entry.description: Sets the compass declination parameter on an ardupilot system. (-3.14 3.14) radians * 100.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_GROUPID
entry.description: Sets the group ID of the target component

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_CESER_STATE
entry.description: Sets the state of the CESER acquisition process.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE
entry.description: Set the Camera Gimbals pointing mode.
entry.param: Mode (as described by SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_MODE_FLAG enum, other=IGNORE)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_CAMERAGIMBAL_VIDEO
entry.description: Set the Camera Gimbals video mode.
entry.param: Mode (as described by SENSOR_CAMERAGIMBAL_VIDEO_FLAG enum, other=IGNORE)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_CAMERAGIMBAL_RECORD
entry.description: Turns on or off local video recording on the Camera Gimbal.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SET_CAMERAGIMBAL_POSITION
entry.description: Sets the Camera Gimbal manual position incrementally.

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_SENSOR_CMD
entry.description: Sends a command to the SensorManager
entry.param: Sensor Component ID (Zero for ALL Sensors)

entry.name: MAVNET_CMD_BEGIN_LAND_SEQ
entry.description: A mission placeholder that indicates the beginning of the landing sequence.

message.name: MAVNET_COMMAND
message.description: Send a command with up to seven parameters to an MAVNet system.
message.field: System which should execute the command
Target Component ID which should execute the command
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply
The mission sequence number for this command (0: Not applied to a mission, greater than 0: mission step)
Command ID, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 1, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 2, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 3, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 4, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 5, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 6, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.
Parameter 7, as defined by MAVNET_CMD enum.

message.name: MAVNET_COMM_GROUP_CONFIGURATION
message.description: MAVNet comms configuration - sent from the server to configure a comm system.
message.field: Mavlink unit ID for this system.
Name of the comm group the system has joined.

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_REQUEST_READ
message.description: Request to broadcast the correspondung MAVNET_PARAM_STATE* for the asset.
message.field: System which should execute the command

message.name: MAVNET_MESSAGE
message.description: Used for sending important system messages between assets and GCSs.
message.field: Severity of message. See enum MAV_SEVERITY.

message.name: MAVNET_MISSION_TRANSFER
message.description: A message informing an MAVNet system to transfer a mission to or from a requestor.
message.field: System which should transfer the mission.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply.
Direction of the mission transfer (0: Upload to MAVNet, 1: Download from MAVNet)
ID (MD5 hash) of the mission to be transfered.
Ascii encoded name of the mission.
The number of individual mission commands that are part of the mission.

message.name: MAVNET_COMM_REGISTRATION
message.description: MAVNet Comms registration message (sent on system startup and at regular intervals).
message.field: The type of the system (see: MAVNET_SYSTEM_TYPE)
Name of the comm group the as defined on the local system.
The serial number of the comm system which is based on the system factory serial number.
Placeholder for microhard information, currently not implemented.

message.name: MAVNET_STATE_COPTER
message.description: MAVNet state message for a *copter.
message.field: Type of the system defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
System id of the device to which we wish to subscribe. (0: none, 255: all)
Timestamp (since UNIX epoch based on GPS)
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Immediate altitude setpoint above home level (positive for up)
Estimate of remaining operation time (0: no estimate, 0xFFFFFFFF: no battery)
The interval between each STATE message when on cellular or WiFi
The interval between each STATE message when on satellite
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)
ID of the currently executing mission (MD5 hash)
Current delay timer in seconds (-1: Infinite delay, 0: No delay, >1 delay sec)
Execution point in the current mission
Status of a mission upload (-1: No upload, 0-100: percent complete)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
System mode bitfield, see MAV_MODE_FLAG ENUM in mavlink/include/mavlink_types.h
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags.
System status flag, see MAV_STATE ENUM
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above ground level (positive for up)

message.name: MAVNET_STATE_ROVER
message.description: MAVNet state message for a rover.
message.field: Type of the system defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
System id of the device to which we wish to subscribe. (0: none, 255: all)
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Estimate of remaining operation time (0: no estimate, 0xFFFFFFFF: no battery)
The interval between each STATE message when on cellular or WiFi
The interval between each STATE message when on satellite
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)
ID of the currently executing mission (MD5 hash)
Current delay timer in seconds (-1: Infinite delay, 0: No delay, >1 delay sec)
Execution point in the current mission
Status of a mission upload (-1: No upload, 0-100: percent complete)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
System mode bitfield, see MAV_MODE_FLAG ENUM in mavlink/include/mavlink_types.h
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags.
System status flag, see MAV_STATE ENUM
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255

message.name: MAVNET_STATE_PLANE
message.description: MAVNet state message for a fixed-wing, quadplane, VTOL.
message.field: Type of the system defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
System id of the device to which we wish to subscribe. (0: none, 255: all)
Timestamp (since UNIX epoch based on GPS)
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Immediate altitude setpoint above home level (positive for up)
Estimate of remaining operation time (0: no estimate, 0xFFFFFFFF: no battery)
The interval between each STATE message when on cellular or WiFi
The interval between each STATE message when on satellite
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)
ID of the currently executing mission (MD5 hash)
Current delay timer in seconds (-1: Infinite delay, 0: No delay, >1 delay sec)
Execution point in the current mission
Status of a mission upload (-1: No upload, 0-100: percent complete)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
System mode bitfield, see MAV_MODE_FLAG ENUM in mavlink/include/mavlink_types.h
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags.
System status flag, see MAV_STATE ENUM
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255
Wind direction (that wind is coming from).
Altitude above home level (positive for up)
Altitude above ground level (positive for up)

message.name: MAVNET_STATE_RELAY
message.description: Data from a communications relay device.
message.field: Type of the system defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
System id of the device to which we wish to subscribe. (0: none, 255: all)
The interval between each STATE message when on cellular or WiFi
The interval between each STATE message when on satellite
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255

message.name: MAVNET_STATE_BEACON
message.description: Data from a beacon device, typically a cellphone running UVDL tracking software.
message.field: Type of the MAV defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM, Added so this message can be used standalone in LB environments
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
System id of the device to which we wish to subscribe. (0: none, 255: all)
The interval between each STATE message when on cellular or WiFi
The interval between each STATE message when on satellite
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255

message.name: MAVNET_STATE_WEATHERPAK
message.description: Data from the MAVNet Weather station interface.
message.field: Type of the MAV defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM, Added so this message can be used standalone in LB environments
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
System id of the device to which we wish to subscribe. (0: none, 255: all)
Estimate of remaining operation time (0: no estimate, 0xFFFFFFFF: no battery)
The interval between each STATE message when on cellular or WiFi
The interval between each STATE message when on satellite
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255
Current operating mode of the system based on SWITCH_MODE enum
The weather sensor unit serial number
Current orientation in degrees, in compass units (0..360, 0=north)

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_COPTER
message.description: Change/report parameters for a COPTER asset; used to compute the parameter hash.
message.field: System which should execute the command. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
Radius of the waypoint acceptance criteria (0-8000)
Enable (1) or disable (0) the battery failsafe
Enable (1) or disable (0) the hand radio failsafe
Vehicle speed in auto and guided modes (20-2000)
Failsafe behavior at EKF failsafe (gps, compass or other sensor failure). 1 = Land, 2 = AltHold, 3 = Land even in Stabilize
Enable (1) or disable (0) the rangefinder failsafe. If enabled, then the vehicle will enter brake mode if altitude is less than the specified altitude and the vehicle is in GUIDED mode.
Number of cells used in the battery (1-12). Read-only when ARMED or if using a smart battery.
Enable (1) or disable (0) the MAVLink pass-thru port. If enabled, a GCS connection will be allowed and MAVNet will engage/disengage as appropriate.
Rally point 1 Altitude above home level, 0 if unused
Rally point 2 Altitude above home level, 0 if unused

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_ROVER
message.description: Change/report parameters for a ROVER asset; used to compute the parameter hash.
message.field: System which should execute the command. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
Radius of the waypoint acceptance criteria (0-8000)
Enable (1) or disable (0) the battery failsafe
Enable (1) or disable (0) the hand radio failsafe
Vehicle speed in auto and guided modes (20-2000)
Failsafe Action 0:Nothing, 1:RTL, 2:Hold, 3:SmartRTL or RTL, 4:SmartRTL or Hold
Number of cells used in the battery (1-12). Read-only when ARMED or if using a smart battery.
Enable (1) or disable (0) the MAVLink pass-thru port. If enabled, a GCS connection will be allowed and MAVNet will engage/disengage as appropriate.
Rally point 1 Altitude above home level, 0 if unused
Rally point 2 Altitude above home level, 0 if unused

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_PLANE
message.description: Change/report parameters for a *PLANE asset; used to compute the parameter hash.
message.field: System which should execute the command. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
Radius of the waypoint acceptance criteria (0-8000)
Enable (1) or disable (0) the battery failsafe
Enable (1) or disable (0) the hand radio failsafe
Vehicle speed in auto and guided modes (20-2000)
Failsafe behavior at EKF failsafe (gps, compass or other sensor failure). 1 = Land, 2 = AltHold, 3 = Land even in Stabilize
Enable (1) or disable (0) the rangefinder failsafe. If enabled, then the vehicle will enter brake/quadplane mode if altitude is less than the specified altitude and the vehicle is in GUIDED mode.
Number of cells used in the battery (1-12). Read-only when ARMED or if using a smart battery.
Enable (1) or disable (0) the MAVLink pass-thru port. If enabled, a GCS connection will be allowed and MAVNet will engage/disengage as appropriate.
Maximum length of the tether (0, 100-40000). Read-only.
Rally point 1 Altitude above home level, 0 if unused
Rally point 2 Altitude above home level, 0 if unused
For QPlane, VTOL to Plane Transition for take-offs and landing in AHL (altitude above Home)

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_RELAY
message.description: Change/report parameters for a RELAY asset; used to compute the parameter hash.
message.field: System which should execute the command. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
Enable (1) or disable (0) the battery failsafe
Number of cells used in the battery (1-12). Read-only when ARMED or if using a smart battery.

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_BEACON
message.description: Change/report parameters for a BEACON asset; used to compute the parameter hash.
message.field: System which should execute the command. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
Enable (1) or disable (0) the battery failsafe
Number of cells used in the battery (1-12). Read-only when ARMED or if using a smart battery.

message.name: MAVNET_PARAM_WEATHERPAK
message.description: Change/report parameters for a WEATHERPAK asset; used to compute the parameter hash.
message.field: System which should execute the command. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
The command state sequence number against which this command should apply. 0 if asset is reporting parameters.
Enable (1) or disable (0) the battery failsafe
Number of cells used in the battery (1-12). Read-only when ARMED or if using a smart battery.

message.name: MAVNET_SENSOR_BATTERY
message.description: Data from a MAVNet Battery sensor which is a component of a MAVNet-provisioned device.
message.field: ASCII serial number of the sensor
Provides information on the current executing command on the device
Incrementing sequence number, device is expected to increment with each msg and not repeat even with reboot
Timestamp (since UNIX epoch based on GPS)
Hash of the currently loaded parameters (MD5 hash)

message.name: MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT
message.description: Submit a new Sensor Event. 135 Bytes, arranged so it likely ends with zeros making it smaller to transmit
message.field: Serial number of the sensor, can determine SensorType, Platform, CommGroup, etc.
Altitude above home level (positive for up). Zero for Ground Level
A displayable name for this Event.
Unique GUID to tie other Data/Media to this Event. Zero for no additional data
Color as RGBA. Sidebar bubble color if ANNOTATION_TYPE is NONE.
Radius in decimeters, zero for point
Event Payload, custom decode by SensorType

message.name: ISSMS_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a ISSMS Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message
message.field: Ride Quality - Peak Vertical Acceleration (G's, E3)
Ride Quality - Peak Longitudinal Acceleration (G's, E3)
Ride Quality - Peak Lateral Acceleration (G's, E3)
ISSMS Alert Type: Roll, Pitch, Battery, etc.
Interpretation depends on alert_type. Signed Value (1E2)

message.name: CESER_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a CESER Sensor Infrastructure Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (8 bytes)
message.field: The number of images the CESER sensor has processed since the flight started
The number of items the CESER sensor has detected since the flight started
Automatically upload to Mavnet. (0. No(Default), 1. Yes)

message.name: ISSMS_BRAKEPRESSURE_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a ISSMS Brake Pressure Sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (5 bytes)
message.field: Brake Pressure (PSI * e2) (Line, Aux, Cyl, Emerg)
State of the brake system ex. Charging, Set, etc.

message.name: SONICTWO_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Sonic TWO Sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message

message.name: ISSMS_JUNCTION_BOX_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes an ISSMS_JUNCTION_BOX Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (36 bytes)

message.name: RADEYE_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a RADEYE Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (?? bytes)

message.name: WAES_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a WAES Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (46 bytes)

message.name: SUPERVOLO_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a SuperVolo Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (9 bytes)
message.field: Current revolutions per minute of the motor

message.name: CAMERAGIMBAL_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a CameraGimbal Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (18 bytes)
message.field: The index of the camera, if multiple are available. Zero is first camera (default)
How the gimbal is pointing the camera.
Which video mode the camera is in.
Status of local recording (0 not recording, 1 recording)
Latitude (WGS84) of the gimbal LOS ground crossing
Longitude (WGS84) of the gimbal LOS ground crossing
Altitude MSL of the gimbal LOS ground crossing

message.name: TEMPERATURE_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Temperature Sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (10+25 bytes)

message.name: BATTERY_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Battery sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (18 bytes)

message.name: SWITCH_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Switch sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (1 bytes)

message.name: CSTAR_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a C-Star sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (10 bytes)
message.field: C-Star Alert Type: Roll, Pitch, Battery, etc.

message.name: GRIPPER_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Gripper sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (1 bytes)

message.name: CAMERA_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Camera sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (4 bytes)
message.field: The index of the camera, if multiple are available. Zero is first camera (default)

message.name: N2NMONITOR_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a N2NMonitor sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (36 bytes)

message.name: G2205_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a G2205 (Picarro device) sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (14 bytes)

message.name: SHIELD_TIMING_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a SHIELD timing sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (18 bytes)
message.field: Arbitration ID of the CAN message
The minimum number of messages allowed
The maximum number of messages allowed

message.name: SHIELD_SIGNATURE_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a SHIELD signature sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (48 bytes)
message.field: Arbitration ID of the CAN message

message.name: SILVUSRADIO_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a SILVUS Radio sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (17 bytes)
message.field: LOS availability and signal strength. (-2: Faulted, -1: Disabled, 0-100: signal strength)
Altitude above mean sea level (positive for up)

message.name: FLOW_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a Flow sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (4 bytes)

message.name: KROMEK_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a KROMEK Radio sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (?? bytes)

message.name: SPACES_SENSOR_LIGHT_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a SPACES Light sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (5 bytes)

message.name: REMOTEID_SENSOR_PAYLOAD
message.description: Describes a RemoteID sensor Payload of a MAVNET_SENSOR_EVENT message (49 bytes)
message.field: Target heading, in compass units (0..360, 0=north, 361 is invalid)
